atoms.title: Understanding Slope Conceptually
atoms.description: Understand what slope represents: the rate of change, steepness, and direction (positive/negative) of a linear relationship. Recognize slope as rise over run conceptually.
atoms.example_easy_question: Which line is steeper: a line that goes up 3 units for every 1 unit to the right, or a line that goes up 2 units for every 1 unit to the right?
atoms.example_medium_question: A line has a positive slope. As x increases, what happens to y? Explain why.
atoms.example_hard_question: Compare the slopes of three lines: one that rises 5 units over 2 units horizontally, one that falls 3 units over 1 unit horizontally, and one that is horizontal. Rank them from steepest to least steep and explain your reasoning.

atoms.title: Calculating Slope from Two Points
atoms.description: Calculate the slope of a line using the formula m = (y₂ - y₁)/(x₂ - x₁) given two points on the line. Apply the formula correctly with positive and negative values.
atoms.example_easy_question: Find the slope of the line passing through points (2, 3) and (5, 9).
atoms.example_medium_question: Calculate the slope of the line through points (-1, 4) and (3, -2). Show your work.
atoms.example_hard_question: Given points A(2a, 3b) and B(5a, 7b), where a and b are constants, find the slope of the line AB in terms of a and b. What happens to the slope if a = 0?

atoms.title: Understanding Y-Intercept Conceptually
atoms.description: Understand what the y-intercept represents: the point where a line crosses the y-axis (when x = 0). Recognize it as the starting value or initial condition in a linear relationship.
atoms.example_easy_question: A line crosses the y-axis at the point (0, 5). What is the y-intercept?
atoms.example_medium_question: Explain what the y-intercept means in the context of a linear function. If a line has a y-intercept of -3, what does that tell you about the line?
atoms.example_hard_question: Two lines have the same slope but different y-intercepts. How are these lines related geometrically? Describe their relationship.

atoms.title: Understanding the Linear Equation Form y = mx + b
atoms.description: Understand the standard form y = mx + b where m represents slope and b represents the y-intercept. Recognize how changes in m and b affect the graph of the line.
atoms.example_easy_question: In the equation y = 3x + 2, what is the slope and what is the y-intercept?
atoms.example_medium_question: Given the equation y = -2x + 5, identify the slope and y-intercept, and describe how the line will look (direction and starting point).
atoms.example_hard_question: Compare the equations y = 4x + 1 and y = 4x - 3. How are these lines similar and different? What would happen if you changed the coefficient of x in the first equation to -4?

atoms.title: Writing Linear Equation from Slope and Y-Intercept
atoms.description: Write the equation of a line in the form y = mx + b when given the slope (m) and y-intercept (b). Substitute values correctly into the standard form.
atoms.example_easy_question: Write the equation of a line with slope 2 and y-intercept -1.
atoms.example_medium_question: A line has a slope of -3/4 and crosses the y-axis at (0, 6). Write the equation of this line.
atoms.example_hard_question: Write the equation of a line with slope 0.75 and y-intercept at the point (0, -2.5). Express your answer in both decimal and fraction form for the slope.

atoms.title: Finding Equation of a Line from Two Points
atoms.description: Determine the equation of a line in the form y = mx + b when given two points. Calculate the slope first, then use one point to find the y-intercept.
atoms.example_easy_question: Find the equation of the line passing through points (1, 2) and (3, 8).
atoms.example_medium_question: Determine the equation of the line through points (-2, 5) and (4, -1). Show all steps.
atoms.example_hard_question: Find the equation of the line passing through points (a, b) and (c, d), where a ≠ c. Express your answer in terms of a, b, c, and d, then verify it works for both given points.

atoms.title: Graphing a Linear Function
atoms.description: Graph a linear function given its equation in the form y = mx + b. Use the y-intercept and slope to plot points and draw the line accurately.
atoms.example_easy_question: Graph the line y = 2x + 1 on a coordinate plane.
atoms.example_medium_question: Graph the line y = -1/2x + 3. Label the y-intercept and show how you used the slope to find additional points.
atoms.example_hard_question: Graph the line y = 3/4x - 2. Then, on the same coordinate plane, graph y = -4/3x + 1. What is the relationship between these two lines? Explain.

atoms.title: Interpreting Slope and Intercept in Real-World Contexts
atoms.description: Interpret the meaning of slope and y-intercept in real-world situations. Understand slope as a rate of change and y-intercept as an initial value or starting condition.
atoms.example_easy_question: A taxi charges $3.50 plus $2.00 per mile. In the equation C = 2m + 3.50, what does the 2 represent? What does the 3.50 represent?
atoms.example_medium_question: The temperature in a room decreases by 2°C per hour. If the initial temperature is 25°C, write an equation and interpret what the slope and y-intercept mean in this context.
atoms.example_hard_question: A company's profit is modeled by P = 15x - 500, where x is the number of items sold. Interpret the slope and y-intercept. How many items must be sold to break even? What does a negative profit mean in this context?
